triage.reason: The finding is related to the chronyd server directive, which may impact time synchronization and potentially affect system behavior. While the severity is moderate, it's unclear what specific changes are required, and the recommendation is to review and remediate.
Disabling root login via SSH is a security best practice, but may have unintended consequences if not properly configured.
triage.estimated_impact: authentication/authorization affected; potential disruption to legitimate root access

triage.reason: SSSD configuration changes may impact authentication and authorization, requiring careful review.
Configuring USBGuard audit backend is a low-risk change that is unlikely to lock out access.

 Usage: usbguard set-parameter [OPTIONS] <name> <value>

 Options:
  -v, --verbose  Print the previous and new attribute value.

execution_details.stdout:
Usage: usbguard [OPTIONS] <command> [COMMAND OPTIONS] ...

 Options:

 Commands:
  get-parameter <name>           Get the value of a runtime parameter.
  set-parameter <name> <value>   Set the value of a runtime parameter.
  list-devices                   List all USB devices recognized by the USBGuard daemon.
  allow-device <id|rule|p-rule>  Authorize a device to interact with the system.
  block-device <id|rule|p-rule>  Deauthorize a device.
  reject-device <id|rule|p-rule> Deauthorize and remove a device from the system.

  list-rules                     List the rule set (policy) used by the USBGuard daemon.
  append-rule <rule>             Append a rule to the rule set.
  remove-rule <id>               Remove a rule from the rule set.

  generate-policy                Generate a rule set (policy) based on the connected USB devices.
  watch                          Watch for IPC interface events and print them to stdout.
  read-descriptor                Read a USB descriptor from a file and print it in human-readable form.

  add-user <name>                Add USBGuard IPC user/group (requires root privilges)
  remove-user <name>             Remove USBGuard IPC user/group (requires root privileges)

 Usage: usbguard append-rule [OPTIONS] <rule>

 Options:
  -a, --after <id>  Append the new rule after a rule with the specified id
                    instead of appending it at the end of the rule set.
  -t, --temporary   Make the decision temporary. The rule policy file will not
                    be updated.
  -h, --help        Show this help.
